How can I tell the difference between staked and mined coins in Verus?

There are several ways to determine if a coin is staked or mined, depending on the interface you are using. If you are using the CLI, you can check the last 10 transactions using `listtransactions`, copy the blockhash of the received award, and add it to the end of `https://explorer.verus.io/api/getblock?` to see if it's minted or mined. If you are using Verus Desktop, you can go to the Mining Dashboard, enter Verus details, and scroll down to the bottom of the page to see the rewards listed as `mined` or `minted` in green. If you are using Verus Agama, you can click on the magnifying glass next to the transaction, open it in the VRSC Explorer, click on the block hash value, and then click on the info "i" to search for the block type, which will show if it's `mined` or `minted`.

# ﻿Question: How can I tell the difference between staked and mined coins?

## CLI:

You can check this in the VerusExplorer https://explorer.verus.io/
1. Check last 10 transactions in the </>CLI. Use `listtransactions`.
2. Copy the blockhash of the received award
3. Add it at the end of https://explorer.verus.io/api/getblock?

Hint: An example: https://explorer.verus.io/api/getblock?hash=9e6fa91356211a554c580c90ec9c2067dd420ff74c7d33481775793f7b0e7f03 – so this one is minted....

## Verus Desktop:

In Verus Desktop, simply go to your Mining Dashboard and enter into Verus details.
Scroll down to the bottom of the page. It will list the rewards as `mined` or `minted` in green.
The TXIDs that staked the minted rewards are shown in blue.

## Verus Agama (Deprecated):

In the GUI you can also click yourself thru to that information.
1. Click on the magnifying glass all the way on the right of the transaction.
2. On the pop-up click on "Open in the VRSC Explorer" bottom left.
3. In the VRSC explorer click on the block hash value (in light blue) – now the block hash is displayed as the title of the box.
4. Click on the info "i" on the right and click on "search": in the result displayed for blocktype 'mined' or 'minted'.(edited)

(submitted by karero, edited by Oink.vrsc@)

Note: last revision date 2020-11-11.
What is the purpose of the Verus Explorer, and how can I use it to determine if a coin is staked or mined?

The Verus Explorer is a tool that allows you to explore the Verus blockchain and get information about transactions and blocks. You can use it to determine if a coin is staked or mined by adding the blockhash of the received award to the end of `https://explorer.verus.io/api/getblock?` and checking the result. If the result shows that the block type is `mined`, then the coin is mined. If it shows that the block type is `minted`, then the coin is staked.

How can I view the rewards I've received in Verus Desktop, and what information will I see about those rewards?

In Verus Desktop, you can view the rewards you've received by going to the Mining Dashboard and entering Verus details. At the bottom of the page, you will see the rewards listed as `mined` or `minted` in green. You will also see the TXIDs that staked the minted rewards in blue. This allows you to easily see which rewards are from mining and which are from staking.
